content.description: Climb the right face of the chimney. Avoid cheating by using the back wall (left). Some of the larger pockets have rat mitten, be aware. The book lists this as 5.10-; maybe it is further right?
content.location: It is right of the deep chimney.

content.description: Climb the face/arete just left of the chimney. Avoid using the back wall (right) of the chimney. A dirty start leads to a semi-pumpy, cobble pinching face. The book rates it 5.10, but it sure felt harder without cheating.
content.protection: Cams with an extended runner provides an anchor.

climbs.name: Kiosk of Dharma
climbs.fa: from Tom Hansen's Climber's Guide to Castlewood

content.description:
The Terminal Area has several short climbs, mostly on toprope.

Amtrak

(already described on Mountain Project) is on an East-facing section of wall.  Kiosk of Dharma is the second north-facing section to the left of

Amtrak

.
content.location:
This is down the easy chimney around the block right of

Amtrak

.

content.description: Battle a dirty face to a semi-deep chimney. This is pretty good per Castlewood standards.
content.protection: A small selection of hand-sized cams.
content.location:
It ascends the chimney between

Hormonal Imbalance

and

Taggart Transcontinental

.

content.description: This route goes up the SW corner between a small section of rock and the main wall in the heart of The Terminal Area.  It starts in a very bushy/mossy crack (whcih can be avoided by climbng slightly to the right) and then redeems itself with a few interesting moves of crack climbing.
content.protection: For the top anchor, have long slings and/or an extra rope and big gear.  If your slings are long enough, you could reach some trees past the rock.  Standard rack.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
